com.team254.lib.util.motion

Class ProfileFollower

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team254.lib.util.motion.ProfileFollower
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HeadingProfileFollower

    public class ProfileFollower
extends java.lang.Object
    A controller for tracking a profile generated to attain a MotionProfileGoal. The controller uses feedforward on acceleration, velocity, and position; proportional feedback on velocity and position; and integral feedback on position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProfileFollower

        public ProfileFollower(double kp,
                       double ki,
                       double kv,
                       double kffv,
                       double kffa)
        Create a new ProfileFollower.
        Parameters:
        kp - The proportional gain on position error.
        ki - The integral gain on position error.
        kv - The proportional gain on velocity error (or derivative gain on position error).
        kffv - The feedforward gain on velocity. Should be 1.0 if the units of the profile match the units of the output.
        kffa - The feedforward gain on acceleration.

    • Method Detail

        public void setGains(double kp,
                     double ki,
                     double kv,
                     double kffv,
                     double kffa)

      • resetProfile

        public void resetProfile()
        Completely clear all state related to the current profile (min and max outputs are maintained).

      • setGoalAndConstraints

        public void setGoalAndConstraints(MotionProfileGoal goal,
                                  MotionProfileConstraints constraints)
        Specify a goal and constraints for achieving the goal.

      • getGoal

        public MotionProfileGoal getGoal()
        Returns:
        The current goal (null if no goal has been set since the latest call to reset()).

      • setGoal

        public void setGoal(MotionProfileGoal goal)

      • setConstraints

        public void setConstraints(MotionProfileConstraints constraints)

      • getSetpoint

        public MotionState getSetpoint()

      • resetSetpoint

        public void resetSetpoint()
        Reset just the setpoint. This means that the latest_state provided to update() will be used rather than feeding forward the previous setpoint the next time update() is called. This almost always forces a MotionProfile update, and may be warranted if tracking error gets very large.

      • resetIntegral

        public void resetIntegral()

      • update

        public double update(MotionState latest_state,
                     double t)
        Update the setpoint and apply the control gains to generate a control output.
        Parameters:
        latest_state - The latest *actual* state, used only for feedback purposes (unless this is the first iteration or reset()/resetSetpoint() was just called, in which case this is the new start state for the profile).
        t - The timestamp for which the setpoint is desired.
        Returns:
        An output that reflects the control output to apply to achieve the new setpoint.

      • setMinOutput

        public void setMinOutput(double min_output)

      • setMaxOutput

        public void setMaxOutput(double max_output)

      • getPosError

        public double getPosError()

      • getVelError

        public double getVelError()

      • isFinishedProfile

        public boolean isFinishedProfile()
        We are finished the profile when the final setpoint has been generated. Note that this does not check whether we are anywhere close to the final setpoint, however.
        Returns:
        True if the final setpoint has been generated for the current goal.

      • onTarget

        public boolean onTarget()
        We are on target if our actual state achieves the goal (where the definition of achievement depends on the goal's completion behavior).
        Returns:
        True if we have actually achieved the current goal.
